requirements.title: Policies for information security
requirements.description: Information security policy and topic-specific policies shall be defined, approved by management, published, communicated to and acknowledged by relevant personnel and relevant interested parties, and reviewed at planned intervals and if significant changes occur.
requirements.description_long: The organization shall define an information security policy that provides management direction and support for information security in accordance with business requirements and relevant laws and regulations. Topic-specific policies shall address specific areas such as access control, physical security, asset management, etc.

requirements.title: Information security roles and responsibilities
requirements.description: Information security roles and responsibilities shall be defined and allocated according to the organization needs.
requirements.description_long: All information security responsibilities shall be defined and allocated. Responsibilities for the protection of individual assets and for carrying out specific information security processes shall be identified. Responsibilities for information security risk management activities and in particular for acceptance of residual risks shall be defined.

requirements.title: Segregation of duties
requirements.description: Conflicting duties and conflicting areas of responsibility shall be segregated.
requirements.description_long: Care shall be taken that no single person can access, modify or use assets without authorization or detection. The initiation of an event shall be separated from its authorization. The possibility of collusion shall be considered in designing the controls.

requirements.title: Management responsibilities
requirements.description: Management shall require all personnel to apply information security in accordance with the established information security policy, topic-specific policies and procedures of the organization.
requirements.description_long: Management shall demonstrate support for information security through the issuance of appropriate policies, procedures and guidelines. Management shall ensure that information security responsibilities are communicated to all personnel.

requirements.title: Contact with authorities
requirements.description: The organization shall establish and maintain contact with relevant authorities.
requirements.description_long: Organizations shall have procedures in place that specify when and by whom authorities shall be contacted and how identified information security incidents shall be reported in a timely manner.

requirements.title: Contact with special interest groups
requirements.description: The organization shall establish and maintain contact with special interest groups or other specialist security forums and professional associations.
requirements.description_long: Membership in special interest groups or forums shall be considered as a means to improve knowledge about best practices and stay up to date with relevant security information.

requirements.title: Threat intelligence
requirements.description: Information relating to information security threats shall be collected and analysed to produce threat intelligence.
requirements.description_long: Threat intelligence shall be collected from multiple sources and analyzed to identify potential threats to the organization. This intelligence shall be used to inform risk assessments and security controls.

requirements.title: Information security in project management
requirements.description: Information security shall be integrated into project management.
requirements.description_long: Information security shall be integrated into project management to ensure that information security risks are identified and addressed as part of project management. This shall apply to any type of project regardless of its nature.

requirements.title: Inventory of information and other associated assets
requirements.description: An inventory of information and other associated assets, including owners, shall be developed and maintained.
requirements.description_long: The organization shall identify information and other associated assets and determine their importance. An inventory of these assets shall be drawn up and maintained. The inventory shall be accurate, up to date, consistent and aligned with other inventories.

requirements.title: Acceptable use of information and other associated assets
requirements.description: Rules for the acceptable use of information and other associated assets shall be identified, documented and implemented.
requirements.description_long: Personnel and external party users using or having access to the organization's information and other associated assets shall be made aware of the information security requirements for protecting and handling the organization's information and other associated assets.

requirements.title: Return of assets
requirements.description: Personnel and other interested parties as appropriate shall return all the organization's assets in their possession upon change or termination of their employment, contract or agreement.
requirements.description_long: The termination process shall be formalized to include the return of all previously issued physical and electronic assets owned by or entrusted to the organization.

requirements.title: Classification of information
requirements.description: Information shall be classified according to the information security needs of the organization based on confidentiality, integrity, availability and relevant interested party requirements.
requirements.description_long: The organization shall develop and implement a classification scheme for information. The classification scheme shall include conventions for classification and criteria for review of classification over time.

requirements.title: Labelling of information
requirements.description: An appropriate set of procedures for information labelling shall be developed and implemented in accordance with the information classification scheme adopted by the organization.
requirements.description_long: Procedures for information labelling shall cover information and other associated assets in physical and electronic formats. The labelling shall reflect the classification scheme established.

requirements.title: Information transfer
requirements.description: Information transfer rules, procedures, or agreements shall be in place for all types of transfer facilities within the organization and between the organization and other parties.
requirements.description_long: Formal transfer policies, procedures and controls shall be in place to protect the transfer of information through the use of all types of communication facilities.

requirements.title: Access control
requirements.description: Rules to control physical and logical access to information and other associated assets shall be established and implemented based on business and information security requirements.
requirements.description_long: Access control rules shall be established, documented and reviewed based on business and information security requirements. Access control rules shall be supported by formal procedures and defined responsibilities.

requirements.title: Identity management
requirements.description: The full life cycle of identities shall be managed.
requirements.description_long: The process to manage identities shall include verification of the identity of the person before providing them with an identity. Identities shall be unique and shall be assigned to a single entity.

requirements.title: Authentication information
requirements.description: Allocation and management of authentication information shall be controlled by a management process, including advising personnel on appropriate handling of authentication information.
requirements.description_long: The allocation of authentication information shall be controlled through a formal management process. Users shall be required to follow the organization's practices in the use of authentication information.

requirements.title: Access rights
requirements.description: Access rights to information and other associated assets shall be provisioned, reviewed, modified and removed in accordance with the organization's topic-specific policy on and rules for access control.
requirements.description_long: A formal user access provisioning process shall be implemented to assign or revoke access rights for all user types to all systems and services. The access rights of all personnel and external party users to information and information processing facilities shall be removed upon termination of their employment, contract or agreement, or adjusted upon change.

requirements.title: Information security in supplier relationships
requirements.description: Processes and procedures shall be defined and implemented to manage the information security risks associated with the use of supplier's products or services.
requirements.description_long: The organization shall identify and document the types of suppliers and the types of supplier access to information and information processing facilities. Information security requirements for mitigating the risks associated with supplier's access to the organization's assets shall be agreed with the supplier and documented.

requirements.title: Addressing information security within supplier agreements
requirements.description: Relevant information security requirements shall be established and agreed with each supplier based on the type of supplier relationship.
requirements.description_long: Agreements with suppliers shall include requirements to address the information security risks associated with information and communications technology services and product supply chain.

requirements.title: Managing information security in the ICT supply chain
requirements.description: Processes and procedures shall be defined and implemented to manage the information security risks associated with the ICT products and services supply chain.
requirements.description_long: Requirements for addressing information security risks applicable to ICT products and services acquisition shall be included in supplier agreements. Suppliers shall be required to propagate appropriate security practices throughout the supply chain.

requirements.title: Monitoring, review and change management of supplier services
requirements.description: The organization shall regularly monitor, review, evaluate and manage change in supplier information security practices and service delivery.
requirements.description_long: Monitoring and review of supplier services shall ensure that the information security terms and conditions of the agreements are being adhered to and that information security incidents and problems are managed properly.

requirements.title: Information security for use of cloud services
requirements.description: Processes for acquisition, use, management and exit from cloud services shall be established in accordance with the organization's information security requirements.
requirements.description_long: The organization shall establish topic-specific policies on the use of cloud services. Processes shall be established for the acquisition, use, management and exit from cloud services.

requirements.title: Information security incident management planning and preparation
requirements.description: The organization shall plan and prepare for managing information security incidents by defining, establishing and communicating information security incident management processes, roles and responsibilities.
requirements.description_long: Responsibilities and procedures shall be established to ensure a quick, effective and orderly response to information security incidents. Information security incident management procedures shall be documented.

requirements.title: Assessment and decision on information security events
requirements.description: The organization shall assess information security events and decide if they are to be categorized as information security incidents.
requirements.description_long: Information security events shall be assessed and it shall be decided if they are to be classified as information security incidents. The classification shall be based on the agreed classification scheme.

requirements.title: Response to information security incidents
requirements.description: Information security incidents shall be responded to in accordance with the documented procedures.
requirements.description_long: Information security incidents shall be responded to by a designated team with the appropriate competence. The response shall include containment, eradication and recovery activities.

requirements.title: Learning from information security incidents
requirements.description: Knowledge gained from information security incidents shall be used to strengthen and improve the information security controls.
requirements.description_long: Mechanisms shall be in place to enable the types, volumes and costs of information security incidents to be quantified and monitored. Information gained from the evaluation of information security incidents shall be used to identify recurring or high impact incidents.

requirements.title: Collection of evidence
requirements.description: The organization shall establish and implement procedures for the identification, collection, acquisition and preservation of evidence related to information security events.
requirements.description_long: Internal procedures shall be developed and followed when dealing with evidence for the purposes of disciplinary and legal action. The procedures shall take into account the requirements of different jurisdictions.

requirements.title: Information security during disruption
requirements.description: The organization shall plan how to maintain information security at an appropriate level during disruption.
requirements.description_long: The organization shall determine its requirements for information security and the continuity of information security management in adverse situations. Information security continuity requirements shall be considered when establishing business continuity management.

requirements.title: ICT readiness for business continuity
requirements.description: ICT readiness shall be planned, implemented, maintained and tested based on business continuity objectives and ICT continuity requirements.
requirements.description_long: ICT continuity plans shall be developed, implemented and tested to ensure that information processing facilities can be resumed within required time frames during disruption.

requirements.title: Legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements
requirements.description: Legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements relevant to information security and the organization's approach to meet these requirements shall be identified, documented and kept up to date.
requirements.description_long: All relevant legislative statutory, regulatory, contractual requirements and the organization's approach to meet these requirements shall be explicitly identified, documented and kept up to date for each information system and the organization.

requirements.title: Intellectual property rights
requirements.description: The organization shall implement appropriate procedures to protect intellectual property rights.
requirements.description_long: Appropriate procedures shall be implemented to ensure compliance with legislative, regulatory and contractual requirements related to intellectual property rights and use of proprietary software products.

requirements.title: Protection of records
requirements.description: Records shall be protected from loss, destruction, falsification, unauthorized access and unauthorized release in accordance with legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements.
requirements.description_long: Records shall be categorized into record types with details of retention periods and type of storage media. Any cryptographic keys and programs associated with encrypted archives or digital signatures shall be retained to enable decryption of records for the length of time the records are retained.

requirements.title: Privacy and protection of PII
requirements.description: The organization shall identify and meet the requirements regarding the preservation of privacy and protection of PII according to applicable laws and regulations and contractual requirements.
requirements.description_long: A data privacy policy shall be developed and implemented. This policy shall be communicated to all persons involved in the processing of personally identifiable information.

requirements.title: Independent review of information security
requirements.description: The organization's approach to managing information security and its implementation including people, processes and technologies shall be reviewed independently at planned intervals, or when significant changes occur.
requirements.description_long: Independent reviews shall be initiated by management. Such independent reviews are necessary to ensure the continuing suitability, adequacy and effectiveness of the organization's approach to managing information security.

requirements.title: Compliance with policies, rules and standards for information security
requirements.description: Compliance with the organization's information security policy, topic-specific policies, rules and standards shall be regularly reviewed.
requirements.description_long: Managers shall regularly review the compliance of information processing and procedures within their area of responsibility with the appropriate security policies, standards and any other security requirements.

requirements.title: Documented operating procedures
requirements.description: Operating procedures for information processing facilities shall be documented and made available to personnel who need them.
requirements.description_long: Documented procedures shall be prepared for system activities associated with information processing and communication facilities. Operating procedures shall specify the instructions for the detailed execution of each job.

requirements.title: Screening
requirements.description: Background verification checks on all candidates to become personnel shall be carried out prior to joining the organization and on an ongoing basis taking into consideration applicable laws, regulations and ethics and be proportional to the business requirements, the classification of the information to be accessed and the perceived risks.
requirements.description_long: Background verification checks shall be carried out in accordance with relevant laws, regulations and ethics. The level of verification shall be proportional to the business requirements, the classification of the information to be accessed and the perceived risks.

requirements.title: Terms and conditions of employment
requirements.description: The employment contractual agreements shall state the personnel's and the organization's responsibilities for information security.
requirements.description_long: The contractual obligations of personnel shall reflect the organization's policies for information security. Contracts with personnel shall include confidentiality or non-disclosure agreements.

requirements.title: Information security awareness, education and training
requirements.description: Personnel of the organization and relevant interested parties shall receive appropriate information security awareness, education and training and regular updates of the organization's information security policy, topic-specific policies and procedures, as relevant for their job function.
requirements.description_long: An information security awareness program shall be established in line with the organization's information security policies and relevant procedures. The awareness program shall be updated regularly.

requirements.title: Disciplinary process
requirements.description: A disciplinary process shall be formalized and communicated to take actions against personnel and other relevant interested parties who have committed an information security policy violation.
requirements.description_long: The disciplinary process shall not be started without prior verification that an information security policy violation has occurred. The formal disciplinary process shall ensure correct and fair treatment for personnel who are suspected of committing violations of information security.

requirements.title: Responsibilities after termination or change of employment
requirements.description: Information security responsibilities and duties that remain valid after termination or change of employment shall be defined, enforced and communicated to relevant personnel and other interested parties.
requirements.description_long: The communication of termination responsibilities shall include ongoing information security requirements and legal responsibilities. Responsibilities contained in any confidentiality agreement and the terms and conditions of employment shall continue for a defined period after the end of the employment.

requirements.title: Confidentiality or non-disclosure agreements
requirements.description: Confidentiality or non-disclosure agreements reflecting the organization's needs for the protection of information shall be identified, documented, regularly reviewed and signed by personnel and other relevant interested parties.
requirements.description_long: Confidentiality or non-disclosure agreements shall address the requirement to protect confidential information using legally enforceable terms. The agreements shall be reviewed when there are changes affecting the requirements.

requirements.title: Remote working
requirements.description: Security measures shall be implemented when personnel are working remotely to protect information accessed, processed or stored outside the organization's premises.
requirements.description_long: Organizations allowing remote working activities shall issue a policy defining the conditions and restrictions for remote working. Appropriate protection shall be in place at the remote working site.

requirements.title: Information security event reporting
requirements.description: The organization shall provide a mechanism for personnel to report observed or suspected information security events through appropriate channels in a timely manner.
requirements.description_long: All personnel shall be made aware of their responsibility to report information security events as quickly as possible. The reporting mechanism shall be easy to use and available.

requirements.title: Physical security perimeters
requirements.description: Security perimeters shall be defined and used to protect areas that contain information and other associated assets.
requirements.description_long: Physical security perimeters shall be clearly defined. The siting and strength of each of the perimeters shall depend on the security requirements of the assets within the perimeter and the results of a risk assessment.

requirements.title: Physical entry
requirements.description: Secure areas shall be protected by appropriate entry controls to ensure that only authorized personnel are allowed access.
requirements.description_long: Access to secure areas shall be controlled and restricted to authorized persons only. Access rights to secure areas shall be regularly reviewed and updated.

requirements.title: Securing offices, rooms and facilities
requirements.description: Physical security for offices, rooms and facilities shall be designed and implemented.
requirements.description_long: Key facilities shall be sited to avoid access by the public. Buildings shall be unobtrusive and give minimum indication of their purpose. Facilities shall be configured to prevent confidential information or activities from being visible and audible from the outside.

requirements.title: Physical security monitoring
requirements.description: Premises shall be continuously monitored for unauthorized physical access.
requirements.description_long: Monitoring systems such as CCTV, intrusion detection systems, and security guards shall be used to monitor premises. Monitoring shall be continuous and cover all entry points.

requirements.title: Protecting against physical and environmental threats
requirements.description: Protection against physical and environmental threats, such as natural disasters and other intentional or unintentional physical threats to infrastructure shall be designed and implemented.
requirements.description_long: Physical protection against natural disasters, malicious attack or accidents shall be designed and applied. Specialist advice shall be obtained on how to avoid damage from fire, flood, earthquake, explosion, civil unrest and other forms of natural or man-made disaster.

requirements.title: Working in secure areas
requirements.description: Security measures for working in secure areas shall be designed and implemented.
requirements.description_long: Controls for working in secure areas shall include controls for the personnel working in the secure area as well as for third party activities taking place there.

requirements.title: Clear desk and clear screen
requirements.description: Clear desk rules for papers and removable storage media and clear screen rules for information processing facilities shall be defined and appropriately enforced.
requirements.description_long: A clear desk policy for papers and removable storage media and a clear screen policy for information processing facilities shall reduce the risks of unauthorized access, loss of and damage to information during and outside normal working hours.

requirements.title: Equipment siting and protection
requirements.description: Equipment shall be sited securely and protected.
requirements.description_long: Equipment shall be sited to reduce the risks from environmental threats and hazards, and opportunities for unauthorized access. Equipment shall be protected from power failures and other disruptions caused by failures in supporting utilities.

requirements.title: Security of assets off-premises
requirements.description: Off-site assets shall be protected.
requirements.description_long: Security shall be applied to off-site assets taking into account the different risks of working outside the organization's premises. Equipment and media taken off the premises shall not be left unattended in public places.

requirements.title: Storage media
requirements.description: Storage media shall be managed through their life cycle of acquisition, use, transportation and disposal in accordance with the organization's classification scheme and handling requirements.
requirements.description_long: Procedures shall be in place for the management of removable media in accordance with the classification scheme adopted by the organization. Media shall be disposed of securely when no longer required.

requirements.title: Supporting utilities
requirements.description: Information processing facilities shall be protected from power failures and other disruptions caused by failures in supporting utilities.
requirements.description_long: Supporting utilities such as electricity, telecommunications, water supply, gas, sewage, ventilation and air conditioning shall be adequate for the systems they are supporting. Supporting utilities shall be regularly inspected and tested.

requirements.title: Cabling security
requirements.description: Cables carrying power, data or supporting information services shall be protected from interception, interference or damage.
requirements.description_long: Power and telecommunications cabling carrying data or supporting information services shall be protected from interception, interference or damage. Additional controls shall be considered for sensitive or critical systems.

requirements.title: Equipment maintenance
requirements.description: Equipment shall be maintained correctly to ensure availability, integrity and continued confidentiality of information.
requirements.description_long: Equipment shall be maintained in accordance with the supplier's recommended service intervals and specifications. Only authorized maintenance personnel shall carry out repairs and service equipment.

requirements.title: Secure disposal or re-use of equipment
requirements.description: Items of equipment containing storage media shall be verified to ensure that any sensitive data and licensed software has been removed or securely overwritten prior to disposal or re-use.
requirements.description_long: Equipment containing storage media shall be checked to ensure that any sensitive data and licensed software has been removed or securely overwritten prior to disposal or re-use. Damaged devices containing sensitive data may require a risk assessment to determine whether the items should be physically destroyed rather than sent for repair or discarded.

requirements.title: User endpoint devices
requirements.description: Information stored on, processed by or accessible via user endpoint devices shall be protected.
requirements.description_long: A policy and supporting security measures shall be adopted to manage the risks introduced by using user endpoint devices. The policy shall require the registration of user endpoint devices.

requirements.title: Privileged access rights
requirements.description: The allocation and use of privileged access rights shall be restricted and managed.
requirements.description_long: The allocation of privileged access rights shall be controlled through a formal authorization process. The identity, access rights and privileges of users with privileged access shall be verified at regular intervals.

requirements.title: Information access restriction
requirements.description: Access to information and other associated assets shall be restricted in accordance with the established topic-specific policy on access control.
requirements.description_long: Access to information and application system functions shall be restricted in accordance with the access control policy. Menu systems shall be used to control access to application system functions.

requirements.title: Access to source code
requirements.description: Read and write access to source code, development tools and software libraries shall be appropriately managed.
requirements.description_long: Access to source code shall be restricted. Source code shall be stored in a secure location with appropriate access controls. Audit logs shall be maintained of all accesses to source code.

requirements.title: Secure authentication
requirements.description: Secure authentication technologies and procedures shall be implemented based on information access restrictions and the topic-specific policy on access control.
requirements.description_long: Authentication information shall be protected by appropriate controls. Multi-factor authentication shall be used where appropriate.

requirements.title: Capacity management
requirements.description: The use of resources shall be monitored and adjusted in line with current and expected capacity requirements.
requirements.description_long: Capacity demands shall be identified, taking into account the business criticality of the system concerned. System tuning and monitoring shall be applied to ensure and improve the availability and efficiency of systems.

requirements.title: Protection against malware
requirements.description: Protection against malware shall be implemented and supported by appropriate user awareness.
requirements.description_long: Detection, prevention and recovery controls to protect against malware shall be implemented, combined with appropriate user awareness. Policies shall prohibit the use of unauthorized software.

requirements.title: Management of technical vulnerabilities
requirements.description: Information about technical vulnerabilities of information systems in use shall be obtained, the organization's exposure to such vulnerabilities shall be evaluated and appropriate measures shall be taken.
requirements.description_long: A timely and appropriate response shall be taken to manage technical vulnerabilities. Vulnerability management shall be integrated with incident management and change management processes.

requirements.title: Configuration management
requirements.description: Configurations, including security configurations, of hardware, software, services and networks shall be established, documented, implemented, monitored and reviewed.
requirements.description_long: Standard configurations shall be established for hardware, software, services and networks. Changes to configurations shall be controlled through the change management process.

requirements.title: Information deletion
requirements.description: Information stored in information systems, devices or in any other storage media shall be deleted when no longer required.
requirements.description_long: Information shall be deleted when no longer required. Deletion shall be performed in accordance with the organization's information retention policy and applicable laws and regulations.

requirements.title: Data masking
requirements.description: Data masking shall be used in accordance with the organization's topic-specific policy on access control and other related topic-specific policies, and business requirements, taking applicable legislation into consideration.
requirements.description_long: Data masking shall be used to protect sensitive data. The level of masking shall be appropriate to the sensitivity of the data and the context in which it is used.

requirements.title: Data leakage prevention
requirements.description: Data leakage prevention measures shall be applied to systems, networks and any other devices that process, store or transmit sensitive information.
requirements.description_long: Data leakage prevention measures shall be implemented to detect and prevent the unauthorized disclosure of sensitive information. Measures shall include monitoring of data flows and blocking of unauthorized transfers.

requirements.title: Information backup
requirements.description: Backup copies of information, software and systems shall be maintained and regularly tested in accordance with the agreed topic-specific policy on backup.
requirements.description_long: Backup copies of information, software and system images shall be taken and tested regularly in accordance with an agreed backup policy. Backup media shall be regularly tested to ensure that they can be relied upon for emergency use when necessary.

requirements.title: Redundancy of information processing facilities
requirements.description: Information processing facilities shall be implemented with redundancy sufficient to meet availability requirements.
requirements.description_long: Redundancy shall be implemented to meet availability requirements. The level of redundancy shall be appropriate to the criticality of the information processing facilities.

requirements.title: Logging
requirements.description: Logs that record activities, exceptions, faults and other relevant events shall be produced, stored, protected and analysed.
requirements.description_long: Event logs recording user activities, exceptions, faults and information security events shall be produced, kept and regularly reviewed. Logging facilities and log information shall be protected against tampering and unauthorized access.

requirements.title: Monitoring activities
requirements.description: Networks, systems and applications shall be monitored for anomalous behaviour and appropriate actions taken to evaluate potential information security incidents.
requirements.description_long: Monitoring shall be performed to detect anomalous behaviour. Monitoring shall include detection of unauthorized access attempts, unusual network traffic patterns, and other indicators of potential security incidents.

requirements.title: Clock synchronization
requirements.description: The clocks of information processing systems used by the organization shall be synchronized to approved time sources.
requirements.description_long: All relevant information processing systems within an organization or security domain shall be synchronized to a single reference time source. Clock synchronization is important for ensuring the accuracy of audit logs.

requirements.title: Use of privileged utility programs
requirements.description: The use of utility programs that might be capable of overriding system and application controls shall be restricted and tightly controlled.
requirements.description_long: The use of utility programs that might be capable of overriding system and application controls shall be restricted and tightly controlled. Utility programs shall be separated from application software.

requirements.title: Installation of software on operational systems
requirements.description: Procedures and measures shall be implemented to securely manage software installation on operational systems.
requirements.description_long: Strict control shall be exercised over the implementation of software on operational systems. Software installation on operational systems shall be controlled by a formal change management process.

requirements.title: Networks security
requirements.description: Networks and network devices shall be secured, managed and controlled to protect information in systems and applications.
requirements.description_long: Networks shall be managed and controlled to protect information in systems and applications. Network security shall include controls for data passing over networks and controls to protect connected systems.

requirements.title: Security of network services
requirements.description: Security mechanisms, service levels and service requirements of network services shall be identified, implemented and monitored.
requirements.description_long: Security features, service levels and management requirements of all network services shall be identified and included in network services agreements. The ability of the network service provider to manage agreed services in a secure way shall be determined and regularly monitored.

requirements.title: Segregation of networks
requirements.description: Groups of information services, users and information systems shall be segregated in networks.
requirements.description_long: Networks shall be segregated based on trust levels, criticality and sensitivity of information systems. Network segregation shall be implemented using physical or logical methods.

requirements.title: Web filtering
requirements.description: Access to external websites shall be managed to reduce exposure to malicious content.
requirements.description_long: Web filtering shall be implemented to reduce exposure to malicious content. Filtering shall include blocking of known malicious websites and categories of websites that are not appropriate for business use.

requirements.title: Use of cryptography
requirements.description: Rules for the effective use of cryptography, including cryptographic key management, shall be defined and implemented.
requirements.description_long: A policy on the use of cryptographic controls for protection of information shall be developed and implemented. Cryptographic key management shall be implemented to support the organization's use of cryptographic techniques.

requirements.title: Secure development life cycle
requirements.description: Rules for the secure development of software and systems shall be established and applied.
requirements.description_long: Rules for the development of software and systems shall be established and applied to developments within the organization. Secure development shall be a mandatory requirement for building secure systems.

requirements.title: Application security requirements
requirements.description: Information security requirements shall be identified, specified and approved when developing or acquiring applications.
requirements.description_long: Information security requirements shall be identified and agreed as part of the requirements specification for new information systems or enhancements to existing information systems.

requirements.title: Secure system architecture and engineering principles
requirements.description: Principles for engineering secure systems shall be established, documented, maintained and applied to any information system development activities.
requirements.description_long: Principles for engineering secure systems shall be established, documented and applied to any information system implementation activities. Secure system engineering principles shall cover all layers of the system architecture.

requirements.title: Secure coding
requirements.description: Secure coding principles shall be applied to software development.
requirements.description_long: Secure coding principles shall be applied to software development. Developers shall be trained in secure coding practices. Code reviews shall be performed to identify security vulnerabilities.

requirements.title: Security testing in development and acceptance
requirements.description: Security testing processes shall be defined and implemented in the development life cycle.
requirements.description_long: Security testing shall be performed during development. Acceptance testing shall include security testing. Security testing shall include testing of security controls and testing for vulnerabilities.

requirements.title: Outsourced development
requirements.description: The organization shall direct, monitor and review the activities related to outsourced system development.
requirements.description_long: Outsourced system development shall be supervised and monitored by the organization. Licensing arrangements, code ownership and intellectual property rights shall be considered.

requirements.title: Separation of development, test and production environments
requirements.description: Development, testing and production environments shall be separated and secured.
requirements.description_long: Development, testing and production environments shall be separated to reduce the risks of unauthorized access or changes to the production environment. The level of separation shall be appropriate to the sensitivity of the production environment.

requirements.title: Change management
requirements.description: Changes to information processing facilities and information systems shall be subject to change management procedures.
requirements.description_long: Changes to information processing facilities and systems shall be controlled. Formal change management procedures shall be documented. Changes shall be assessed for potential security impacts.

requirements.title: Test information
requirements.description: Test information shall be appropriately selected, protected and managed.
requirements.description_long: Test data shall be selected carefully, protected and controlled. The use of operational data containing personally identifiable information or any other confidential information for testing purposes shall be avoided.

requirements.title: Protection of information systems during audit testing
requirements.description: Audit tests and other assurance activities involving assessment of operational systems shall be planned and agreed between the tester and appropriate management.
requirements.description_long: Audit requirements and activities involving verification of operational systems shall be carefully planned and agreed to minimize the risk of disruptions to business processes. Audit tests shall be performed in a controlled manner.
